qas.question: Where on Earth is the highest marine activity recorded?
Which areas are composed as the Coral Triangle?

answers.text: Indonesia, Philippines, and Papua New Guinea.

qas.question: Which area is called the heart of the world's Coral reef biodiversity?
Name the largest species of fish in the world.
What are found in Southeast Asia's deep waters?
What ecosystem has the lowest biodiversity in Asia?
Where did Conservation International say the lowest biodiversity is?

plausible_answers.text: South China Sea and the Pacific Ocean territories of the Philippines

qas.question: Where is the world's only species of sea turtle found?

context: The shallow waters of the <b5_0>Southeast Asian <b4_0>coral reefs<b5_0/><b4_0/> have the highest levels of biodiversity for the world's marine ecosystems, where coral, fish and molluscs abound. According to Conservation International, marine surveys suggest that the marine life diversity in the <a0_0><b6_0>Raja Ampat<b6_0/><a0_0/> (Indonesia) is the highest recorded on Earth. Diversity is considerably greater than any other area sampled in the Coral Triangle composed of <a1_0>Indonesia, Philippines, and Papua New Guinea.<a1_0/> <a2_0>The Coral Triangle<a2_0/> is the heart of the world's coral reef biodiversity, the Verde Passage is dubbed by Conservation International as the world's "center of the center of marine shorefish biodiversity". <a3_0>The whale shark<a3_0/>, the world's largest species of fish and 6 species of sea turtles can also be found in the <b7_0>South China Sea and the Pacific Ocean territories of the Philippines<b7_0/>.
